title: To Kill a Mockingbird
author: Harper Lee
description: A novel about the serious issues of rape and racial inequality, but it's also full of warmth and humor.

author: George Orwell
description: A dystopian social science fiction novel and cautionary tale about the dangers of totalitarianism.

title: Pride and Prejudice
author: Jane Austen
description: A romantic novel that charts the emotional development of the protagonist, Elizabeth Bennet.

title: The Great Gatsby
author: F. Scott Fitzgerald
description: A story of the mysteriously wealthy Jay Gatsby and his love for the beautiful Daisy Buchanan.

title: Moby-Dick
author: Herman Melville
description: An epic tale of the voyage of the whaling ship Pequod, led by Captain Ahab who is obsessed with the giant white whale, Moby Dick.

title: War and Peace
author: Leo Tolstoy
description: A historical novel that chronicles the history of the French invasion of Russia and the impact of the Napoleonic era.

title: The Catcher in the Rye
author: J.D. Salinger
description: A novel about teenage rebellion and angst as seen through the eyes of the protagonist, Holden Caulfield.

title: The Hobbit
author: J.R.R. Tolkien
description: A fantasy novel that follows the quest of Bilbo Baggins to win a share of the treasure guarded by the dragon Smaug.

title: Crime and Punishment
author: Fyodor Dostoevsky
description: A psychological drama about the moral dilemmas faced by the poor ex-student Raskolnikov who plans to kill a pawnbroker.

title: Brave New World
author: Aldous Huxley
description: A dystopian novel that explores the dangers of a technologically advanced future society.

title: The Lord of the Rings
author: J.R.R. Tolkien
description: An epic fantasy trilogy that follows the quest to destroy the One Ring and defeat the Dark Lord Sauron.

title: Jane Eyre
author: Charlotte Brontë
description: A novel about the experiences of its eponymous heroine, including her growth to adulthood and her love for Mr. Rochester.

title: The Catch-22
author: Joseph Heller
description: A satirical novel set during World War II that examines the absurdities of war and bureaucracy.

title: Little Women
author: Louisa May Alcott
description: A novel about the lives and struggles of the four March sisters during the Civil War era.

title: Wuthering Heights
author: Emily Brontë
description: A novel that explores the destructive and passionate love between Heathcliff and Catherine Earnshaw.

title: The Brothers Karamazov
author: Fyodor Dostoevsky
description: A philosophical novel that explores the complex relationships between the brothers Karamazov and their father.

title: The Alchemist
author: Paulo Coelho
description: A novel that tells the story of Santiago, a shepherd boy on a journey to find a hidden treasure.

title: The Odyssey
author: Homer
description: An epic poem that follows the hero Odysseus as he attempts to return home after the Trojan War.

title: The Picture of Dorian Gray
author: Oscar Wilde
description: A novel about a young man whose portrait ages while he remains eternally youthful and indulges in a life of vice.

title: Anna Karenina
author: Leo Tolstoy
description: A novel that tells the tragic story of a married aristocrat and her affair with the affluent Count Vronsky.
